Detailed Description

This class represents the Minkowski error objective functional of a multilayer perceptron. This objective functional is used in data modeling problems.

See also:
MultilayerPerceptron.

InputTargetDataSet.

Definition at line 32 of file MinkowskiError.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::MinkowskiError::MinkowskiError ( MultilayerPerceptron *  newMultilayerPerceptron,
InputTargetDataSet *  newInputTargetDataSet 
)

General constructor. It creates a Minkowski error objective functional object associated to a multilayer perceptron and measured on an input-target data set. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display = true.
  • MinkowskiParameter = 1.5.

Parameters:
newMultilayerPerceptron Pointer to a multilayer perceptron object.
newInputTargetDataSet Pointer to an input-target data set object.

Definition at line 43 of file MinkowskiError.cpp.

References inputTargetDataSet, and minkowskiParameter.

Flood::MinkowskiError::MinkowskiError ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates Minkowski error objective functional object not associated to any multilayer perceptron and not measured on any input-target data set. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display = true.
  • MinkowskiParameter = 1.5.

void Flood::MinkowskiError::setMinkowskiParameter ( double  newMinkowskiParameter  ) 

This method sets a new Minkowski exponent value to be used in order to calculate the error. The Minkowski R-value must be comprised between 1 and 2.

Parameters:
newMinkowskiParameter Minkowski exponent value.

Definition at line 125 of file MinkowskiError.cpp.

References minkowskiParameter.

double Flood::MinkowskiError::calculateEvaluation ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the objective functional value of a multilayer perceptron according to the Minkowski error on an input-target data set.

See also:
calculateGradient(void).

Vector< double > Flood::MinkowskiError::calculateGradient ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the the Minkowski error function gradient of a multilayer perceptron on an input-target data set. It uses the error back-propagation method.

See also:
calculateEvaluation(void).

Reimplemented from Flood::ObjectiveFunctional.

void Flood::MinkowskiError::saveInputTargetAndOutput ( char *  filename  ) 

This method saves to a data file the inputs and the targets in the input-target data set, together with the outputs from the multilayer perceptron for that inputs.
